result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of Motion Hearing held on October 14, 2022
State's Motion to Deny Defendant's Motion to Suppress Without a Hearing (with Affidavit in Support of Response to Defendant's Motion)
Exhibit #3 was not received by the Court. See docket for details.
Oral ruling on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 9:56 AM.
Defendant Robert W. Christopher in court with Attorney Christopher Wilhelm.  Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Agent Wade Beardsley of the WI DOJ/DCI. He is sworn and testifies. Cross examination by Defense.
Attorney Wilhelm indicates that he did not receive a response brief filed by Attorney Piltz to the Motion to Suppress. Attorney Piltz indicates he thought it was filed but it may not have been.
Defense offers Exhibit #1 and #2. Exhibits #1 and #2 are received. Re-Direct by State. State offers Exhibit #3. Defense objects. Court orders Exhibit #3 is not yet received. Counsel to discuss and/or stipulate as to if the testimony of Attorney Ronquist will be necessary.
Witness excused. Parties to submit briefs regarding the Motion to Suppress. Attorney Piltz to file his original brief response to the Motion to Suppress.
Defense to file brief by 11/22/22 and State to respond by 12/6/22. 
Oral Ruling: 1/17/23 at 10:00 AM (in person).
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence (Amended)
Dated 08/24/2022, Letter from Attorney Christopher Wilhelm to Court regarding Amended Motion to Suppress.

(Case called at 3:46 PM- by Zoom) Defendant Robert W. Christopher appeared by phone.  Attorney Christopher Wilhelm appeared by video for Robert W. Christopher. Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to personal appearance. Defense acknowledges receipt of Information. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court receives Not Guilty pleas. 
Court orders any motions to be filed by August 12, 2022. Motion Hearing: 9/20/2022 at 10:00 AM (Set for 1 hour- IN PERSON).

1:32 PM case 22CF204 called. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert W. Christopher in court.  Attorney Christopher Wilhelm in court for Robert W. Christopher. 
State calls Detective Wade Beardsley to testify- is sworn and testifies. 
Defense stipulates to what the images contain as it pertains to child pornography for today's hearing only. Record to reflect identification of the defendant by Detective Beardsley. 
Cross examination by the Defense. Witness excused. 
Court finds probable cause and binds matter over to Branch 5.
